title: sans serif mystery?
content:
I have been thinking about this one since the past summer when I saw it, but I kept forgetting to post it...

At first it looked like one of Spiekermann’s designs, but then not really once I checked them all out...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [promonte.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213031834/http:/typophile.com/files/promonte.jpg) | 39.99 KB |
author: Ragusa

comments.content:
Looks like its a custom font  
 [http://www.newlyn.com/custom\_type\_detail/preview\_pdf/8/Telenor\_specimen....](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213031834/http:/www.newlyn.com/custom_type_detail/preview_pdf/8/Telenor_specimen.pdf "http://www.newlyn.com/custom\_type\_detail/preview\_pdf/8/Telenor\_specimen.pdf")  
 [http://www.newlyn.com/fonts/custom/telenor](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213031834/http:/www.newlyn.com/fonts/custom/telenor "http://www.newlyn.com/fonts/custom/telenor")

OMG and thank you so much Agostini!!!! Where have you found this treasure? I Googled and Googled, but nothing came up.... THANKS AGAIN!

I would have never guessed!

“Ad augusta per angusta.”
